page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: Dunham Massey is a predominantly rural area close to Altrincham, on the Southern Edge of Greater Manchester.The area is made up of small villages and hamlets, farms and a suburban part of Altrincham,but the whole area is dominated by Dunham Massey Hall and Park. The Hall dates from the early eighteenth century and was taken over by the National Trust in 1976.The parkland area has a large herd of deer and is also used for leisure activities from jogging to riding.Each year the Hall presents an Edwardian Extravaganza. We have concentrated our information on the hall and park, but have also looked at types of housing and the lives of some of the residents in the area ranging from a school pupil to a deerkeeper and a farmer.
